intro: Peucedanum nevadense var. cupulatum, commonly known as the Nevada cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Nevada, United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive silvery underside that reflects light. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh, high-altitude environments of its native range.
